captions.text: [DIAL-UP SOUND]

-It was on Monday, the 8th of
August, 2011, that Britain's
superstructure collapsed.

By midnight, it was clear that
the police and the government
had lost control.

For one night, at least,
delinquent anarchy had proved

more powerful than fellowship
and bureaucracy.

On Monday afternoon, with shops
boarded up, it was clear

that all London needed to
explode was a spark.
And this was it.

At the narrows at the end of
Mare Street in Hackney, three
police vans swerved to a stop.

About 10 policemen
rushed two men.

A crowd quickly formed, exciting
themselves and
freaking out the police.

Soon there were two groups, and
bricks were being thrown.
[SHOUTING]

-A gridlock of cop
cars and rioters
grew beneath the bridge.

And soon there was a running
battle up Mare Street.
-Oh shit.
[SHOUTING]

-The crowd was split into two,
half of whom were chased up

Morning Lane, where they
broke into Tesco's.

"Missile up," they shouted while
pulling out Coke cans

and bottled water and charging
towards the cops.
[SHOUTING]

-The rest of the crowd were
moved up Mare Street.

And that's when everything
started to go crazy.

[SHOUTING, BREAKING
GLASS, SIRENS]

-As the daylight robbery turned
into midnight chaos, it

became increasingly dangerous to
be seen on the street with

a camera, or just without
any bag of swag.

We made our way to Kingsland
Road, though, where we heard

that the local Turks had driven
the rioters off by

running down the street with
blades and weapons.

comments.text:
As a Londoner, this period of time was one of the few times I felt safest 
on the streets. Knowing I wouldn't get robbed or asked what ends I'm from, 
but there was an overwhelming sense of unity in the community as I was even 
offered to help out "show the police who's boss" although I declined. On 
the other hand, I've never been so shook of getting caught slippin by fed, 
who would undoubtedly throw me in a bully van and batter me to release 
frustration and their feelings of failure. I'm still glad to be a Londoner 
nonetheless. Best city in the world.﻿

The UK was powerful. WAS. You never had anywhere near the influence the US

Forces soldier for that matter. You try to maintain whatever deflated ego

British M.O.

The US as a country and its military as a whole is levels above yours. Just

way. We are better than you. Period.

I see by the videos you watch you're also an Eminem (an American

comments.text:
+FlyingGiantKuntAttak Believe it or not, I just  got back from LA on Feb 
the 14th. Didn't see a whopping number of fat people. Im not really sure 
why this is a big thing with you Brits over there. That being that America 
has fat people. Like I said before, you're country is one of the fattest 
nations on the planet! Ours is fat but yours is fat too! Thats what I don't 
get. It aint like you guys are some health nuts over there. You're fat too!

No, you're Special Forces does not train ours. Both militaries cross train 
with each other and get instruction and classes on different weapons 
systems, tactics, etc. All thats for is to establish stronger ties amongst 
the allies and to gain a different persepective. There is nothing that the 
US SF lacks that requires an outside country to come in and instruct us. 
This misconceived notion that US Spec Op soldiers go to get trained by 
British soldiers as a part of the regular and required training is false 
and you guys really need to wake up. Soldier for soldier? Well I expect you 
to stand up for your country but there is no way the British outmatch 
American soldiers on the battlefield. 

Oh, and all this bullshit about the world wide web and shit. Who gives a 
fuck. And sending in drones compared to soldiers has nothing to do with

fight ISIS, which I don't recall them doing, then why haven't they wiped 
them out?? What are they waiting on? Keep on dreaming my Brit friend. You 
have a long way to go to catch up to the US or regain the status you once 
had in this world.

establishment of the US, but many of the accomplishments that followed the

incorrect. That argument might hold some water if you would have said that 
most Americans who live in the backwoods are racist. But then again thats 
not where the majority of the US population lives, so saying that its more 
accurate, is false.

According to food.ndtv.com, the US has about 33% of it's population of 
being obese. Ok, we got some fat people. I find it funny though when we 
receive criticism from Europe about it. That same list puts the UK at 
26.9%, Russia at 26%, Germany at 25%, and Spain at 26%. Out of 196 
countries in the world, several in Europe happen to be some of the fattest. 
So yea we got some fatties, but guess what, you guys are right up there 
with us. Especially the UK so be careful who you're stereotyping as fat, ok 
fatties?

different videos on the internet - would there be any chance I could use a 
few seconds from your video? (The street scenes near the beginning).

The premiere is on 17th November (just less than 2 weeks). 

The event is here - "Rough for Opera", The Cockpit Theatre, Marylebone.

Please let me know either way - thanks!

Jenni﻿

comments.text:
it makes no sense because you are from such a different background that you 
see this as alien behaviour and cant relate it to the UK. There are areas 
of the UK with immigrant communities from Glasgow to Derry. Also, 
disaffected violent kids are in every ethnic group, the focus on black 
people is mostly because of the USA media influence on the UK. The black 
population of the UK doesnt commit anywhere near the crimes whites of the 
same class do, but recieve a lot more harrasment from police. I am white, 
and have grown up seeing my black friends treated differently to me. It 
might sound trivial but it really does create resentmant. The worst parts 
of England for mindless crime are up north, in mostly white areas. Its on 
neighbourhood gov statistics websites if want to check.
